item.title: NC PAN July 2017 Board Meeting: Minutes
item.dc:creator: Autumn Racine
item.description: NCPAN July 2017 Monthly Board Meeting Meeting started at 7:13pm Members Present: Jennifer Levenbook Jennifer Johnson Laura Pearl Jennifer Temple Jasmine Berry Sarah Brady Wagner   Motion: Approve previous meeting’s minutes-everyone does. Officer Reports: Treasurer- NCPAN owes Jennifer Levenbook $2500 and there is less than that in the bank account. Start up costs. All […]
item.content:encoded:
NCPAN July 2017 Monthly Board Meeting

Meeting started at 7:13pm

Members Present:

Jennifer Levenbook

Jennifer Johnson

Laura Pearl

Jennifer Temple

Jasmine Berry

Sarah Brady Wagner

 

Motion: Approve previous meeting’s minutes-everyone does.

Officer Reports: Treasurer- NCPAN owes Jennifer Levenbook $2500 and there is less than that in the bank account. Start up costs. All other founding loans have been paid back.

Membership- No Greensboro nannies are really interested yet. Need graphics and to give info to Greensboro agencies. Make it clear there are other members besides Jennifer Johnson. Flyers and cards are self-print. Planning a BBQ in Greensboro in September, probably at a park, to invite the Greensboro nannies to.  

Motion: Have Jennifer Johnson look at parks. She agreed.

Continuing Officer Reports: Social Chair- Past Events-NNO at the movies, low turnout. People don’t want to go unless it is popular. Paint and Sip will be planned in September. Fridays are better for some than Saturdays. Field Day will be in August. Moana and Wonder Woman are popular NNO movies. August 4th, playdate at Kidzu (note from minutes taker, I’ll actually be at that one as far as I know!). People with non-napping older kids who want afternoon playdates should host them.

Action: Recruit more members with older kids.

Continuing Officer Reports: Professional Development-Going to plan some. (and then talk about ideas later in the meeting)

Discussion: a lot of nannies who come to events aren’t NCPAN members. Members get to vote and make decisions but all nannies, member or not, can benefit from the events. Nannies don’t know how to ask for bosses to pay for trainings. Assertiveness Training would help with that.

Continuing Officer Reports: continuing with Treasurer- NNTD fund is in the negative. Can transfer from the swag fund, membership fund, social committee fund, or petty cash. In the black $422.42 overall. NNTD fund is under by $62.15.

Discussion: NNTD speakers loved being there. Good variety of topics. Downfall was how long the day was. Air conditioner was broken, that didn’t help. People enjoyed it. Speakers caused the negative money, not enough tickets sold to break even or make money. Written commitment by a sponsor- Nanny By Design- (minutes have been corrected to which agency it was actually) to cover a speaker’s cost was not honored. That sponsor-Nanny By Design- has been blacklisted. They have been slow to pay before, and now they didn’t pay the $400, which would have put NNTD fund in the positive.

Motion: correct the minutes about which sponsor that was from the beginning. Seconded. (minutes are correct from the beginning now)

Motion: Blacklist Nanny By Design. All agreed.

Discussion: NCPAN is tired of running NNTD. Next year an agency-My Girl Friday- wants to run it. NCPAN will help if the agency wants it, but not run it. If no one else is going to run it, NCPAN will step up and run it.

Discussion: Old Business-Field Day- in a yard near a private residence in Carrboro, address available to people RSVPed yes. Area will be given. Alternative could be Oval Park, but they don’t have a bathroom. The private residence yard has bathroom(s) available in the house. A water hookup outside and permission to use all the water needed. Trampoline available. Liability wavers given out. Contests to see who spills the least amount of water. Kiddie pools and an inflatable pool and a sprinkler to play in.  NCPAN will provide the watermelon. Bring your own picnic lunch. NCPAN will bring toilet paper. Don’t forget.

Motion: Caroline (minutes taker) bold the previous statement. I agree, has been put in bold. I also put Actions in bold, so I made the toilet paper statement bigger print as well.

Discussion of Field Day continued- juice boxes will be provided too. Thinking about the date being August 1st, but that’s next week, people might need more time. August 15th was decided on. 10am-1pm. Bring swim diapers.

Motion: to correct the minutes to put Professional Development here and not over there with the Officer Reports. Seconded. (No problem-corrected)

Discussion: Professional Development Ideas- Childcare. Probably not CPR. Assertiveness Training. Contracts. Leadership. Financial Literacy. Self-care. Healthcare. Two hour long professional development.

Discussion: Firehouse Outing. Could go to Chapel Hill, Carrboro, or Durham. Raleigh would be good to get Raleigh nannies interested and Durham was last year. Raleigh area-near the airport. Lots of Raleigh nannies live (or their nanny families live) near the airport. Or Cary. Deciding when and whether to try to include older kids. Tried to plan for Columbus Day but not all schools are off. So it will be toddlers only. Sept 5th. 10am.

Discussion: October will be a Halloween craft. Week of the 23rd.

Motion: Asked Jennifer Temple, Professional Development Officer, to have a proposal of what topic to focus on for professional development by next meeting. She agreed.

Discussion: What to for NCPAN going forward. Whether to keep it just playdates and professional development. Wanting to help nannies learn about healthcare. Wanting NCPAN to expand and do more things. Need more local, but non Triangle, affiliates. Need to plan out the guidelines for them. How many playdates and professional developments they will need to do. Clear checklist of what they would need to do to maintain. What each chapter would need to do and where they are. Raleigh nannies could have their own chapter. The board would be the NC board and get the information from each chapter about what they are doing. Each chapter would need a mini board of their own. The NC board will make sure that each chapter is meeting their goals. Also they would help the chapters by networking them a solution to what they are working on. Each chapter would be responsible for a capstone dinner at the end of NNRW. Nannies would go to the chapter in the town/area where they nanny. Chapters could spend their money on their area. Each chapter would pay an affiliation fee to NCPAN. Treasurer could maintain the membership fees and accounts for each chapter to start. If it got big and each chapter had a treasurer there would be measures put in place to keep everything clean and no embezzlement. Each chapter would need a Professional Development Officer and also a Social Chair. Optional Liaison Person. People have to be a member to start their own chapter. Free to start, after a year there will be a $10 fee. Chapters get 90% of membership fees from their chapter to spend on their chapter.

Discussion: Benefits of being an NCPAN member. Get to vote and help decide things. Free or reduced cost of events. Good to network with other nannies in the area. Helping the nannies of NC become better nannies through professional development classes and networking.

Discussion: How to recruit volunteers. Make a personal invitation from a trusted friend. Provide trusted friends with stationery and postage and ask them to hand write a plea to help. Also help them know what to say in the plea. Calling is the next best way, email after that.

Discussion: Bring in more charity work to show the volunteers the benefits to the community. Also professionally help them learn to work with other people and other skills like event planning. People would work for NCPAN not the charity though.

Action: Look at charity options. Plan a Nanny Work Day to benefit the community. Making sure the charity is going to help with professional development. Like holding babies at the hospital to help and learn how to hold babies. Will be discussed more when options are looked into.

Amendment Proposal: Have an official code of ethics. Mostly for the board members, because they are the face of NCPAN and we can’t force other members to follow it. Being committed of a crime, misuse of NCPAN’s social media, use of profanity on the social media. All members are not allowed to cyberbully. Board members have special rules. Don’t break the law. Code of conduct is on the NCPAN facebook page.

Motion: Jasmine, email out the proposed code of ethics to the board 10 days before the next meeting. She agreed.

Meetings will be the 4th Tuesday of the month. Aim to have in person meeting at least 4 times a year. Rest can be call in.

Next meeting will be August 22nd 7pm.

Review of actions: Graphics for memberships. Going to plan a BBQ or NNO in Greensboro in Sept. Going to pick a Paint and Sip for NNO. Moana Aug 11th and Wonder Woman August 19th for NNOs. Wear Nanny shirts. Field Day August 15th 10am-1pm. Firehouse Sept. 5th. Halloween Craft the week of Oct. 23rd. Figure out what’s in the affiliate package. Email out the proposed code of ethics.

Meeting Adjourned at 8:44pm

Minutes by Caroline Harmon

item.title: NC PAN March 2017 Board Meeting: Minutes

item.description: NCPAN March 2017 Monthly Board Meeting Meeting started at 7:07pm Members Present: Jenni Levenbook Sarah Brady Jennifer Johnson Jasmine Berry Laura Pearl Discussion about NNTD marketing push Action: need as many nannies as possible Action: keep Triangle nannies from going to Charlotte Action: Committee meeting next week Action: Board members emailing schools Motion: Sarah makes […]
item.content:encoded:
NCPAN March 2017 Monthly Board Meeting

Meeting started at 7:07pm

Members Present:

Jenni Levenbook

Sarah Brady

Jennifer Johnson

Jasmine Berry

Laura Pearl

Discussion about NNTD marketing push

Action: need as many nannies as possible

Action: keep Triangle nannies from going to Charlotte

Action: Committee meeting next week

Action: Board members emailing schools

Motion: Sarah makes a template and emails preschools-Sarah agrees

Motion: Jennifer Johnson makes a list and emails Greensboro schools-Jennifer agrees

Motion: Laura emails private schools (non public regular schools)-Laura agrees (with help)

Discussion about any new memberships

Action: Find out if there are any new memberships (a board member will be emailed when a new member joins)

Discussion about past and future crafts

Action: Easter craft is April 14th  (changed from April 4th to be on the same day as the hunt)

Action: Easter egg hunt is April 14th   (in Solite park in Durham)

Discussion about not needing permission to have the hunt at the park

Action: Easter egg hunt has two times, 1030 (changed from 1230) for toddlers and 330 for older children

Discussion about timing, who would be able to go.

Discussion about last year’s turnout for morning and afternoon.

Action: find a person to run the craft for older kids

Action: get older kids to come to the hunt/craft

Discussion about how to make crafts for older kids

Discussion about funds for supplies (confirmed funds)

Motion: get the craft supplies from Aishia -members working on that

Action: put the Easter egg hunt info everywhere

Discussion about how people don’t rsvp, how many crafts to make (too many but enough)

Discussion about whether NCPAN has money (yes but needs more NNTD tickets sold, 8 sold so far)

Discussion about tickets sold through My Girl Friday, flyer will be emailed out this week. Unless the agency workers have work or another obligation they are expected to go to NNTD

Action: if a board member can’t access their NCPAN email, contact Jenni for a reset

Action: board members need to check their emails (can get them forwarded or set up on your phone for easier checking)

Action: email the schools from the NCPAN email

Discussion about how to add an email account to a phone

Discussion about getting the board meeting email to regular email addresses, automatic system

Discussion about NNO in March, and there will be one in April

Discussion about the fact that the frost killed the strawberries at the usual farm, so no picking

Motion: Have an NNO in June- all agreed

Action: don’t plan anything soon after NNTD

Discussion about Nannypalooza, in Maryland in October

Action: promote Nannypalooza at NNTD

Action: buy Nannypalooza tickets soon, they sold out last year

Meeting Adjourned at 7:37pm

Minutes by Caroline Harmon

item.content:encoded:
NCPAN January 2017 Monthly Board Meeting

Meeting Started at 7:38pm

Members Present:

919-428-4393

Jennifer Johnson

Laura Pearl

Sarah Brady

919-594-4287

Jenni Levenbook

Beginning of the meeting was not recorded.

Discussion about needing to contact the Raleigh Fire Dept.

Discussion about either baby related topic or STEM.

Action: Need to contact STEM- to confirm. If not STEM, look into baby-wearing speaker.

Discussion about once speakers are confirmed, people can choose which ones they want to be with when they register.

Action: Flyers will be made. NNTD committee meeting will be called. Tell all Nannies about NNTD

Discussion about Registration/Ticket Purchase is available, not yet able to pick slots for speakers

Action: 5 dollars off if registration is before 11:59PM Thursday 1/19/2017

Action: Tell all NC nannies on Facebook about NCPAN’s NNTD

Action: Need someone (possibly Aishia, or former/current board member) to go to LinkedIn and send out a mass email with registration url to all nannies in network

Discussion of how to find and email nannies on LinkedIn and the importance of keeping track of who was emailed to avoid double-emailing

Motion: Sarah will help-Sarah agreed

Discussion about Marketing for NNTD, query for new ideas for 2017

Action: Flyers, “My Girl Friday” agency will email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, reached out to Carolina Parent about a Nanny Story, going to reach out to radio and news stations about NNTD, waiting for speakers to confirm. Reach out to Community news (example: The Cary Citizen) and Mother/Childcare Groups too.

Action: Need more Raleigh groups/marketing because NNTD is in Raleigh

Discussion about having a social in Raleigh before NNTD

Motion: Call Laura about NNOs in Raleigh and Cary.-Laura agrees.

Discussion about NNOs, including karaoke

Action: Fill the calendar with events

Action: Have more NNOs and crafts and other professional development before NNTD

Action: NNOs in Feb and March

Discussion about the website, Jenni Levenbook got it up and running, Bigtent is no longer the one to use.

Discussion: 4 tickets sold for NNTD

Action: Must sell NNTD tickets

Action: Planning committee for NNTD will receive email about in person meeting

Motion: next meeting will be Thursday, Feb 16th 730pm-all agreed

Discussion of how to record meetings

Action: Find new secretary

Discussion about Caroline Harmon being a good fit for that

Motion: Ask Caroline-all agreed (note: Caroline also accepted the position)

Discussion about a Triangle Caregivers Meetup organizer stepping down

Motion: NCPAN taking over the Meetup-all agreed

Discussion of failed meetups for that group at IHOP in Raleigh

Action: market crafts and events through the Meetup

Meeting Adjourned at 832pm

Minutes by Caroline Harmon
